alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:38AM EST until January 29 at 7:40AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Haw River Near Bynum affecting Chatham County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Haw River near Bynum. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The river widens up to 400 feet across. It floods pastureland on the right bank and woodlands on the left. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:16 AM EST Sunday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 11.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Haw River Bynum 11.0 10.8 Sun 9 am EST 9.4 7.3 6.3 5.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
